subject: Curlin (Race Horse)
Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Still hesitant to race Curlin in the Breeders’ Cup Classic, the owner Jess Jackson announced Thursday that the immediate goal for the horse was the Jockey Club Gold Cup at Belmont Park on Sept. 27. With a win in the $750,000 race, Curlin, the 4-year-old horse of the year, would become the sport’s top money-earner and the first horse to top $10 million. The announcement made no mention of the Breeders’ Cup, where Curlin could meet the top 3-year-old, Big Brown. When reached, Jackson did not rule out a Breeders’ Cup start. He was concerned that the race would be run on a synthetic surface at Santa Anita, something Curlin had never raced on.
